* The University of Texas at Dallas is partnering with the National Cricket League USA (NCL USA) to host the Sixty Strikes tournament, a 10-day event featuring six teams from around the world.
* The tournament will use a shortened 60-ball format, known for high-scoring matches and lasting around 90 minutes.
* The event aims to showcase the sport's growth in the United States, with NCL USA chairman Arun Agarwal calling it a "groundbreaking moment for cricket in the U.S."
* The University of Texas at Dallas is an ideal location due to its international student population and the presence of the Comets Cricket Club.
* The tournament is expected to captivate a diverse audience and elevate the sport's presence in North Texas.

* Australia's Test captain, Pat Cummins, recently participated in the MLC in the United States.
* Cummins has announced an eight-week break to rejuvenate himself ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against India later this year, citing the need to recover physically after nearly 18 months of continuous bowling.
* This break will allow him to focus on gym workouts, running, and rehabilitation exercises to manage his workload effectively and reduce the risk of injuries.

* He played a key role in Washington Freedom's MLC title win, scoring 88 runs off 52 balls in the final, which led to a 96-run victory.
